result.value:
* [Yamashita, K., Wojdyr, M., Long, F., Nicholls, R. A., Murshudov, G. N. (2023) "GEMMI and Servalcat restrain REFMAC5" *Acta Cryst.* D**79**, 368-373](https://doi.org/10.1107/S2059798323002413)
* [Yamashita, K., Palmer, C. M., Burnley, T., Murshudov, G. N. (2021) "Cryo-EM single particle structure refinement and map calculation using Servalcat" *Acta Cryst. D***77**, 1282-1291](https://doi.org/10.1107/S2059798321009475)
Structure refinement and validation for crystallography and single particle analysis

**S**tructur**e** **r**efinement and **val**idation for **c**rystallography and single p**a**r**t**icle analysis 
and a Refmac5 controller
  * `refmacat`: behaves as Refmac, but uses GEMMI for restraint generation instead of MAKECIF

```
pip install servalcat
```
will install the stable version.

The required GEMMI version is now [v0.6.7](https://github.com/project-gemmi/gemmi/releases/tag/v0.6.7). It may not work with the latest gemmi code from the github. The policy is in the main branch I only push the code that works with the latest package of GEMMI.

To use the Refmac5 related commands, you also need to install [CCP4](https://www.ccp4.ac.uk/). For "No Refmac5" commands, you may just need [the monomer library](https://github.com/MonomerLibrary/monomers) if CCP4 is not installed.

**Notice:**
From ver. 0.4.6, Servalcat is no longer python-only package and has some C++ code. If you build Servalcat by yourself, probably you also need to build GEMMI using the same compiler.

result.description:
* refmacat: --keep_entities copies entities from input to output
* geometry related changes
  * show sigmas in outliers
  * support symmetry in angles (only through external restraints)
  * ignore hydrogen chem_type from dictionary (not to fail with unknown hydrogen atom types)
  * bug fix: external restraints should be read after loading topology
  * NCS restraint related bug fixes
* requires gemmi 0.6.7

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/keitaroyam/servalcat/compare/v0.4.82...v0.4.88

* refmacat: bug fix for unrestrained refinement
* refine: bug fix for adp restraint with ncs restraint
* refine_xtal_norefmac
  * experimental implementation of twin refinement
  * in intensity refinement, R1 is calculated instead of "R2", using I/sigma>2
  * fixed broken reading of shelx hkl file
* included in CCP4 9.0.003

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/keitaroyam/servalcat/compare/v0.4.77...v0.4.82

* refmacat
  * quick workaround for "given" NCS matrices
  * fix label_seq_id in output mmcif
  * fix erroneous handling of unknown external restraint keywords
  * bug fix for unrestrained refinement
  * write servalcat version to mmcif
* NoRefmac refinement
  * add --newligand_continue option
* refine_xtal_norefmac
  * don't allow negative or more-than-unity occupancies
* fsc
  * made model masking optional (--mask_model)
* included in CCP4 9.0.002

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/keitaroyam/servalcat/compare/v0.4.74...v0.4.77

* refmac_keywords: fixed infinite loop occurring when "symm" was specified in an atom spec
* refine/refmacat: add metal links only when requested
* fw: support anomalous intensity input
* included in CCP4 9.0.001

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/keitaroyam/servalcat/compare/v0.4.72...v0.4.74

- refinement and map calculation related changes
  - no longer discriminates between ATOM/HETATM records
  - refmacat
    - cap occupancy at 1 for refmac compatibility
    - fix elements in the model using monlib
    - prevent duplicate block names in output mmcif
    - refmac compatibility fix for strict ncs
    - bug fix for missing chain IDs
  - geometry
    - exclude plane atoms within 1-4 distance from vdw
  - refine_spa_norefmac
    - reduced data stats printing
    - new option: --target_bond_rmsz_range
  - refine_spa / refine_spa_norefmac
    - no longer include F(000)
    - lower correlation cutoff for helical symmetry test
    - soft mask creation made much faster
  - "No Refmac" refinement in general
    - now understands refmac keywords "restr tors incl" and excl
    - don't write hydrogen to the output model by default
    - refmac way of weight adjustment
    - write stats json every cycle (for ccp4i2)
    - (experimental) occupancy-only refinement with restraints
    - fixed wrong second derivative calculation wrt occupancy
    - add outliers to stats.json
    - always normalise space group name in the structure
  - refmac keywords:
    - "end" to stop in each file
    - fixed reading "exte weig scal" lines
- new command: util add_op3
- new command: util dnarna
- util geom: add --nucleus option
- requires gemmi 0.6.6
- included in CCP4 9.0.000

- now `python -mservalcat` works instead of `-mservalcat.command_line`
- refinement and map calculation related changes
  - group occupancy refinement implemented
  - update old atom names in the model (if available as `_chem_comp_atom.alt_atom_id`)
  - check duplicated atoms
  - show polymer gaps
  - geometry
    - local NCS restraints implemented
    - nonbonded interaction now doesn't rely on altlocs, but checks sum of occupancies and occupancy group (Refmac way)
    - use all hydrogen torsion angles
    - remove duplicated links
    - fix atom order in bonds: duplication wasn't resolved properly
    - fix link wrongly considered Asu::Different if symmetry code not given in the model file
    - limit ideal angle to [0,180]; e.g. an ideal value of -180 caused a problem
    - fix wrong reporting of torsion angle values
    - ignore bad (NaN) ideal chirals
  - refine_geom --update_dictionary
    - support pdbx_model_Cartn_x_ideal
    - write json file (requested by acedrg)
    - made more robust. there was a risk for H position to be NaN when the geometry was very poor
  - refmacat
    - ignore entities in input
    - refmac workaround for long residue names
    - fix for 3 letter chain IDs
    - fix for Refmac bug (DNA became non-polymer entity after Refmac)
    - don't prepare crd if unrestrained refinement requested
    - fix MAKE keyword reading
    - write H/D expanded mmcif file as well
    - fix issues arisen when used from acedrg: empty chains, wrong date format, space in _entry.id
  - crystallographic refinement
    - refine_xtal_norefmac & refine_cx: fail if model and data symmetry mismatch
    - allow anomalous data input and calculate anomalous difference map
    - remove FP<=0
- util seq: check unknown seq (wrong model)
- util geom: --selection added

requires gemmi 0.6.5.

- refinement and map calculation related changes
  - show bin stats in cycle 0
  - fix ADP constraints
  - harmonic restraints implemented
  - metals: user's keywords have priority
  - refine_xtal_norefmac:
    - intensity: added an FOM proxy
    - solvent mask: use Refmac radii and ignore H/zero-occupancy atoms
    - smoothen ML parameters (D and Sigma)
    - amplitude target and derivatives in C++
  - refmacat
    - add --version option
    - fix buffered output in refmacat
- Refmac pipeline
  - print raw output when failed to check the version #13
- symmetry: bug fix for negative helical rise
- util geom: support exte keywords
- requires gemmi 0.6.3

- refinement and map calculation related changes
  - bug fix: it failed when the link header refers to non existent atoms (including 'gap' links)
  - don't add new links automatically. `--no_link_check` was obsoleted, and `--find_links` was added.
  - "no refmac" refinement in general:
    - ADP restraints: don't put distance dependence for bond and angle related pairs.
    - report ADP rms.
    - check -LL difference after ml parameter optimization
    - bug fix in bond angle rmsd reporting
    - bug fix in second derivative smoothing
  - refine_xtal_norefmac:
    - least square scaling significantly improved
    - ADP restraints now uses KL divergence as Refmac does. more controllable parameters
    - automatic weight decision
    - write *_stats.json
    - change --use_all_in_est to --use_work_in_est
    - amplitude target: fixed an anisotropy bug introduced in the previous version
    - intensity: fix wrong derivatives
    - intensity: use all reflection to ML refine B_aniso
    - binning-independent second derivative calculation
    - use previous result as initial for ML scaling and least square scaling
    - guess free flag number automatically
    - ignore nan in CCavg calculation
    - stop extending to lowest resolution
    - bug fix: --ligand didn't work
  - refine_spa_norefmac:
    - fix target function (only affects printed -LL)
    - add --keep_entities
    - bug fix: expand ncs keeping links in Fc calculation
- fsc
  - model based mask and the sharpen-mask-unsharpen procedure are back
- trim
  - fix for symmetry code in the link headers. was problematic when symmetry-related links exist
- fix for numpy/pandas rc* version number
- new command: util adp
  - show ADP stats and histogram
- new command: util seq
  - print sequences of the model and align using input sequence to detect mutations.
- tests fixed for Windows
- included in CCP4 8.0.016

- refinement and map calculation related changes
  - fixed accidental TER problem (TER in between polymer residues caused breakage of polymer links)
  - use of metals.json in restraints https://github.com/MonomerLibrary/monomers/pull/28
  - write SSBOND header in pdb (_struct_conn.conn_type_id disulf in mmcif)
  - support chemcomp block in input model
  - refine_xtal_norefmac:
    - ML parameter refinement stabilised
    - do not load monomer library when --unrestrained
    - report CCavg, the averaged correlation over resolution bins weighted by the number of reflections
    - now --source is required
    - add --no_link_check
    - bug fix and many improvements in intensity target
    - bug fix in space group decision
    - fixed negative diagonal bug in log likelihood part
    - bug fix in same_asu decision in link finding (crystallographic translation was overlooked)
    - add neutron support (but no hydrogen refine)
    - do not overwrite model space group unless needed (as COOT does not seem to support "R -3 m:H" style)
  - refine_spa_norefmac:
    - support symmetry-related links
  - "no refmac" refinement in general:
    - print data stats by resolution
    - add max_vdw_radius to cap van der waals radius as a quick fix for K+
  - per-atom geometry violation score
  - SPA refinement: Fupdate is now calculated as \<F\> + F_diff
  - refine_geom: --update_dictionary re-adds hydrogen before 2nd round
- refmacat
  - fix vdwr/vand/nonb keyword parsing
  - fix links for DOD when changing to HOH 
  - write crd file in output dir
  - delete crd file unless --keep_original_output is given
- fw: find intensity columns automatically and keep test set
- new command: util map2mtz
- CMakeLists.txt added, thanks @wojdyr
- MANIFEST.in added (previous package missed some files for compilation)
- requires gemmi 0.6.2
- included in CCP4 8.0.012

From this release Servalcat has some C++ codes, and needs to be built with GEMMI. If you build it by yourself, you also need to build GEMMI (PyPI's binary won't work).

- servalcat.log file name can be changed by --logfile (must be put before subcommand)
- refmacat
  - no longer find symmetry related links
  - ignore everything after `end` instruction
  - bug fix: `make hout` was not parsed
- Servalcat's (no Refmac) refinement related changes
  - special position constraints
  - CG solver moved to C++
  - support small molecule files
  - changed --sigma_b default to 10
  - bug fixes in solvent mask grid spacing
  - refine_spa_norefmac
    - change file name diffmap* to prefix_diffmap*
  - refine_xtal_norefmac
    - support CCP4-unsupported space groups
    - change --labin to use comma separated input
    - (experimental) add --jellyonly
    - (experimental) intensity based refinement
- new command: fw
  - French & Wilson type intensity to amplitude conversion
  - ML refinement of anisotropy parameters
- util map_peaks
  - bug fix: happened when there are peaks with the same map value and volume
  - write a json file
- util nemap
  - (experimental) local Fourier weighting --local_fourier_weighting_with
- util geom
  - (experimental) add --check_skew
  - add --ignore_h
- requires gemmi 0.6.1
- dropped python2 support

- Notice: the previous version produced mmcif files that could not be used for PDB deposition (fixed in https://github.com/project-gemmi/gemmi/commit/a8cc7e62)
- new command: `refine_geom`
  - Servalcat's own implementation of geometry optimisation (no Refmac)
  - supports Refmac external restraint keywords (except for interval and harmonic)
  - TODO: NCS restraints, special positions
- new command: `refine_spa_norefmac` (experimental)
  - Servalcat's own implementation of refine_spa (no Refmac)
  - this is an experimental feature and not fully functional yet
  - coordinates, isotropic and anisotropic ADPs can be refined with symmetry constraints
  - all geometry restraints available in refine_geom can be used
  - only "throughout" type cross validation is available
  - TODO: occupancies, special positions, faster Fc calculation
- new command: `refine_xtal_norefmac` (experimental)
  - Servalcat's own implementation of amplitude (MLF) target refinement (no Refmac)
  - this is very experimental but you can try if you are brave enough (feedback is welcome)
  - TODO: automatic binning and weighting, more robust parameter estimation etc
- `refmacat` (refmac5 wrapper)
  - now mostly functional
- `refine_spa`
  - use gemmi to prepare restraints (as in refmacat) if Refmac5.8.404 or newer is available
  - no hydrogen after shaking in cross validation
  - bug fix: masked refinement did not work if model is placed out of the box
  - checks if map and model symmetry match
  - ignores ORIGIN header
  - always writes a summary json file
  - write_coot_script: fix for helical case (coot does not support translation)
- `refine_cx`
  - write hydrogen to file by default
  - support _symmetry_equiv_pos_as_xyz cif tag
  - add --invert option
- `util map_peaks`
  - add negative peaks and fix symmetry bug
- `fsc`
  - add amplitude cc and mean(cos(dphi))
- requires gemmi 0.6.0
- included in CCP4 8.0.011

- new command: `refmacat` (or `servalcat refmac5`)
  - use gemmi to prepare restraints and then refmac5 to refine the model (Yamashita et al. 2023 submitted).
  - can be used in the same way as refmac5 command from ccp4, with some additional options
  - now gemmi is almost fully consistent with makecif
- new command: `util map_peaks`
  - find map peaks in ASU (space group + strict ncs) and write a script for Coot
- include F(000) in map to F transform, which affects masking
- `refine_spa`
  - symmetry: add --contacting_only option to only consider strict NCS copies that make contact with ASU
  - write add_molecular_symmetry function in coot script (requires new coot >0.9.8.5?)
  - setup entity before writing mmcif file. it was inappropriate for pdb deposition if the input was pdb format
  - bug fix for https://gitlab.com/ccpem/ccpem/-/issues/111
  - --gemmi_prep to use gemmi (like refmacat)
  - experimental: add --mask_soft_edge
- obsolete: `sfcalc` (use `refine_spa --prepare_only`)
- fsc
  - obsolete --mask_radius, --mask_soft_edge, --b_before_mask, --no_sharpen_before_mask
  - calc phase randomised half map FSC
  - add symmetry options
  - mask Fc map
- `refine_cx`
  - disable bulk solvent by default
  - add --ligand option
- `util expand`
  - add --split option
- `util mask_from_model`
  - add --selection option
- `localcc`
  - add --kernel_ang to specify radius in Angstrom (hard sphere)
- API change
  - logger.write won't add newline; use logger.writeln
- requires gemmi 0.5.8

- fofc 
  - sharpen Fo-Fc map using variance of unexplained signal instead of total signal
- refine_cx
  - now `--hklin` can accept smcif hkl
- refmac5 (new command/experimental)
  - a wrapper program that uses gemmi to prepare restraints. the latest development version of Refmac is required.
- fixes due to API changes in gemmi 0.5.7

- new commands
  - `util h_density`: Fo-Fc map analysis for hydrogen
  - `util helical_biomt`: prepare BIOMT of helical reconstruction for PDB deposition
- refine_spa
  - `--no_shift` is on by default
  - bug fix: ASU model test did not work d1babf83
  - test input mask
  - write coot script
- fofc
  - `--normalized_map` is on by default
  - test input mask
  - apply mask to Fc map as well (better Fo-Fc map for helical reconstruction)
- sigmaa
  - do not use weights in least square scaling
- refine_cx
  - add `--hklin_labs`
- other bug fixes (helical symmetry 0e6fa770, merging ligand cif files 5abd7119, trimming in `util nemap` 40fb39d7)
- requires gemmi 0.5.6

- new commands
  - `util geom`: an experimental command to check model geometry and its outliers
  - `util applymask`: apply a mask to a map
  - `localcc`: calculate real space local correlation between half maps or between full map and model
- `refine_spa`
  - add workaround for resi >9999 case
  - fixed broken code for microheterogeneity
  - add a check of symmetry related contacts to give error if symmetry-expanded model is given with symmetry operators
- `refine_cx`
  - add --blur and --hydrogen options
- `sigmaa`
  - add --no_solvent option
  - write R and CC to log
  - now works on complete set and fill DFc for FWT when missing
  - anisotropic correction is now applied to FP (except when calculating R or CC)
- `util fcalc`
  - add --auto_box_with_padding and --no_expand_ncs options
  - --source: support neutron 
- bug fixes 
- exit with return code 1 when input was invalid
- requires gemmi 0.5.4

- new commands
  - `sigmaa`: calculate D (in DFc) and variance of unexplained signal against MLF target for crystallography
  - `util fix_link`: fix LINKR/_struct_conn records in the model
  - `util merge_dicts`: merge restraint dictionary cif files
  - `util blur`: Blur data (mtz) by specified B value
- `refine_spa`
  - find new links and fix LINK records in the model before the refinement (#4)
  - provisional TLS support
  - remove duplications and rename modification if needed when multiple ligand cif files given
  - ignore zero-occupancies in ADP analysis
  - stop if ligand cif file is not a restraint file (#3)
  - fix for non-integer residue number
- `fofc`
  - use `-B` value directly (not taking difference)
- `refine_cx`
  - support sm/mmcif for `--model`
  - add `--sg` option and more automatic choice of space group
  - fix reading shelx res file and pdb with blank residue/chain name
  - add `--bref iso_then_aniso`
- resolution binning and bin traversing made faster
- use oxygen scattering factor for element X
- bug fixes
- support for gemmi changes (0.5.3)

- new commands
  - `util nemap`: calculate normalised expected map from half maps (as done in `refine_spa` and `fofc`)
  - `refine_cx`: REFMAC5 pipeline for chemical crystallography
- refine_spa
  - write a summary json file
  - calculate Fo-Fc map even in the absence of half maps
  - check CCP4_SCR directory
  - keep original chain IDs in mmcif
  - revert LINK records after refinement in case of microheterogeneity
- trim
  - trim unit cell when --no_shift
- bug fixes
- support for gemmi changes (0.5.1)

- new commands
  - `util expand`: expand symmetry
  - `util power`: calculate power spectrum
  - `util fcalc`: calculate F_calc from model
  - `util json2csv`: convert refined_fsc.json to csv file
  - `translate`: a simple translation function (model into map)
- refine_spa
  - file name changed: shifted_local to local, local_refined to shifted_refined
  - turn off overall anisotropic scaling in Refmac
  - changed `--weight` to `--weight_matrix`
  - cross validation: turn off jelly body after shaking
  - cross validation: do shaking in refmac
  - show final summary
  - fixed sharpen-mask-unsharpen procedure
  - calculate FSC at higher resolution
  - `--pg`: support I1-I4 conventions
  - write refined_fsc.json
  - calculate Rcmplx (experimental)
  - sfcalc: meaning of `--no_shift` is changed, and its old behavior is taken over by `--no_trim`
  - add `--mask_radius_for_fofc`
- trim
  - add `--no_shift option`
- fofc
  - `--crop` renamed to `--trim`
  - `--trim_mtz` added
- many bug fixes
